title: Sheet-Pan Lemon Herb Chicken & Veggies
description: Roasted thighs with potatoes, carrots, and green beans in a lemon-garlic herb glaze.

title: Crispy Air-Fryer Honey-Chili Salmon
description: Sticky-sweet salmon with crisp edges and a quick chili glaze.

title: One-Pot Creamy Tomato Basil Pasta
description: Creamy tomato basil pasta that cooks in a single pot for fast cleanup.

title: 15-Minute Veggie Fried Rice
description: A quick skillet dinner using day-old rice and freezer veggies.

title: No-Knead Skillet Garlic Bread
description: Chewy-crisp garlic bread baked in a cast-iron skillet.

title: Garlic Butter Skillet Chicken
description: Juicy skillet-seared chicken with a quick garlic-butter pan sauce.
instructions: Pat chicken dry. Season both sides with salt, pepper, and paprika.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and sear 5–6 minutes per side (depending on thickness) until browned and cooked through. Transfer to a plate.
Reduce heat to medium. Add butter; once melted, stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in chicken broth and thyme. Scrape up browned bits and simmer 2–3 minutes to slightly reduce.
Stir in lemon juice (optional). Return chicken to the skillet and spoon sauce over the top for 1–2 minutes.
Garnish with parsley and serve.
notes: If your chicken breasts are thick, pound to even thickness for faster, juicier cooking.
Great with rice, mashed potatoes, or roasted vegetables.
nutrition: Nutrition will vary by cut of chicken and serving size. Estimates are approximate.

title: Honey Chipotle Chicken Bowls
description: Sweet-heat chicken bowls with rice and fresh toppings—meal-prep friendly.
ingredients: 2 tbsp chipotle sauce (or 1–2 chipotle peppers in adobo, minced)
1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed (for serving)
1 1/2 cups corn (frozen or canned, drained) (for serving)
Toppings: diced avocado, pico de gallo, chopped cilantro, sliced jalapeños (optional)
instructions: Whisk honey, chipotle, olive oil, paprika, cumin, garlic powder, salt, and lime juice.
Toss chicken in the sauce and let sit 10 minutes (or up to 1 hour).
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken 6–7 minutes per side (or until 165°F).
Rest 5 minutes, then slice.
Assemble bowls: rice, beans, corn, sliced chicken, and your favorite toppings.
notes: For extra char, broil cooked chicken for 1–2 minutes after slicing.
Make it milder by using chipotle sauce instead of whole peppers.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on bowl components and portion size.

title: One-Pan Lemon Herb Salmon
description: Bright, simple salmon baked on one pan—minimal cleanup, maximum flavor.
ingredients: Optional: 1 tbsp capers or chopped parsley
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (205°C). Line a sheet pan with parchment.
Place salmon on the pan. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle garlic and dill over the top and lay lemon slices across the fillets.
Bake 12–15 minutes, until salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Finish with capers or parsley if using, and serve.
notes: If your fillets are thin, start checking at 10 minutes.
Serve with roasted asparagus or a simple salad.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on salmon size and oil used.

title: Slow Cooker Beef Barbacoa
description: Fork-tender shredded beef with smoky spices—perfect for tacos and bowls.
ingredients: 2 chipotle peppers in adobo, minced (plus 1 tbsp adobo sauce)
instructions: Place onion in the bottom of a slow cooker. Add the roast on top.
Add garlic, chipotle peppers, adobo sauce, broth, vinegar, lime juice, cumin, oregano, salt, pepper, and bay leaf (optional).
Cook on LOW for 8 hours (or HIGH for 4–5 hours) until very tender.
Shred beef with two forks and stir back into the juices.
Serve in tacos, burrito bowls, or sandwiches.
notes: For less heat, use 1 chipotle pepper instead of 2.
Leftovers freeze well for up to 2 months.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on cut of beef and serving size.

title: Creamy Tuscan Chicken
description: Creamy garlic sauce with sun-dried tomatoes and spinach—restaurant vibes at home.
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Sear chicken 5–6 minutes per side until cooked through; remove.
Reduce heat to medium. Add butter and garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Pour in broth, then add cream, Parmesan, Italian seasoning, and sun-dried tomatoes. Simmer 3–5 minutes until slightly thickened.
Stir in spinach to wilt. Return chicken to the pan and spoon sauce over top for 2 minutes.
Serve hot.
notes: Swap heavy cream for half-and-half for a lighter sauce (it will be thinner).
Great over pasta, rice, or mashed potatoes.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and will vary by cream/cheese amounts.

title: Vegetarian Stuffed Bell Peppers
description: Hearty, colorful peppers stuffed with rice, beans, corn, and melty cheese.
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup shredded cheese (cheddar or Mexican blend)
Optional: chopped cilantro, sour cream, sliced green onions
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Slice tops off peppers and remove seeds. Place peppers upright in a baking dish.
In a bowl, mix rice, beans, corn, salsa, cumin, chili powder, salt, and 1/2 cup cheese.
Fill peppers and top with remaining cheese.
Add a splash of water to the bottom of the dish. Cover with foil and bake 25 minutes.
Uncover and bake 10 more minutes until peppers are tender and cheese is bubbly.
notes: Use quinoa instead of rice for extra protein.
If peppers won’t stand, slice a thin piece off the bottom to level them.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on cheese and portion size.

title: Shrimp Scampi Pasta
description: Garlic-butter shrimp tossed with lemony pasta—fast and classic.
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1/2 cup dry white wine (or chicken broth)
instructions: Cook pasta in salted water until al dente. Reserve 1/4 cup pasta water and drain.
Season shrimp with 1/2 tsp salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Sear shrimp 2 minutes per side; remove.
Add remaining butter, garlic, and red pepper flakes; cook 30 seconds.
Pour in wine (or broth) and lemon juice. Simmer 2 minutes.
Add pasta, reserved pasta water, and shrimp; toss to coat. Stir in parsley and serve.
notes: Don’t overcook shrimp—remove as soon as they turn pink and firm.
Add a handful of spinach at the end for an easy veggie boost.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on pasta portion and butter used.

title: Pulled Pork Sliders with Coleslaw
description: Tender pulled pork piled on soft buns with crunchy slaw—tailgate-ready.
ingredients: 1 cup BBQ sauce (plus more for serving)
instructions: Season pork with salt, pepper, paprika, and garlic powder.
Place pork in a slow cooker and add chicken broth.
Cook on LOW 8 hours (or HIGH 5–6 hours) until shreddable.
Shred pork and stir in BBQ sauce. Keep warm.
Assemble sliders with pulled pork, coleslaw, and pickles if using.
notes: For crispier edges, broil shredded pork on a sheet pan for 5 minutes before saucing.
Leftovers make great nachos, baked potatoes, or quesadillas.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on bun size and sauce amount.

title: Buffalo Chicken Dip
description: Creamy, spicy, and dangerously scoopable—perfect for parties.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked shredded chicken (rotisserie works great)
1/2 cup ranch dressing (or blue cheese dressing)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix chicken, cream cheese, buffalo sauce, ranch, and 3/4 cup cheese until combined.
Spread into a small baking dish and top with remaining cheese.
Bake 18–22 minutes until hot and bubbly.
Top with green onions if using. Serve with chips, celery, or toasted bread.
notes: Make it extra spicy by adding a pinch of cayenne.
This reheats well in the microwave in 30-second bursts.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on cheese/dressing used.

title: Loaded Nacho Sheet Pan
description: A full-pan nacho situation with seasoned beef, melted cheese, and fresh toppings.
ingredients: 1/2 cup black beans (optional), drained and rinsed
1/2 cup diced tomatoes or pico de gallo
Toppings: sour cream, salsa, guacamole, chopped cilantro
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (205°C).
Brown ground beef in a skillet. Add taco seasoning and water; simmer 2 minutes.
Spread chips on a sheet pan. Sprinkle beef, beans (optional), and cheese evenly over top.
Bake 8–10 minutes until cheese melts.
Top with tomatoes, jalapeños, and your favorite toppings. Serve immediately.
notes: For best crunch, serve cold toppings on the side and add as you eat.
Swap beef for shredded chicken or black beans for a meatless version.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and varies with toppings and chip amount.

title: BBQ Bacon Meatballs
description: Juicy meatballs wrapped in bacon and finished with a sticky BBQ glaze.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (205°C). Line a baking sheet with foil and place a rack on top if you have one.
Mix beef, breadcrumbs, egg, onion, salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Form into 24 small meatballs.
Wrap each meatball with half a slice of bacon and secure with a toothpick.
Bake 20 minutes. Brush with BBQ sauce and bake 8–10 more minutes until bacon is crisp and meatballs are cooked through.
Serve warm.
notes: Use turkey bacon if you want a lighter option (it won’t crisp as much).
Keep warm in a slow cooker on LOW for parties.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and will vary by bacon and sauce used.

title: Cheesesteak Egg Rolls
description: Philly-inspired egg rolls stuffed with steak, peppers, onions, and melty cheese.
ingredients: 1 lb shaved steak (or thinly sliced ribeye)
6 slices provolone (or 1 1/2 cups shredded mozzarella/provolone blend)
Oil for frying (or air-fryer cooking spray)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion and pepper 4–5 minutes until softened.
Add steak, salt, and pepper. Cook 2–3 minutes until just done. Let cool slightly.
Lay an egg roll wrapper in a diamond shape. Add 2–3 tbsp filling and a bit of cheese. Fold and roll tightly, sealing the edge with beaten egg.
Fry in 350°F (175°C) oil for 3–4 minutes until golden (or air fry at 390°F for 8–10 minutes, flipping halfway).
Serve with queso, ranch, or spicy ketchup.
notes: Cooling the filling prevents wrappers from getting soggy and tearing.
For extra cheesiness, add a small cube of cheese in the center before rolling.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and will vary by frying method and cheese amount.

title: Crispy Parmesan Roasted Potatoes
description: Golden roasted potatoes with a salty Parmesan crust and garlic flavor.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Toss potatoes with olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and Italian seasoning.
Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet, cut-side down.
Roast 35–40 minutes until browned and tender.
Sprinkle Parmesan over potatoes and roast 5 more minutes.
Garnish with parsley and serve.
notes: Don’t overcrowd the pan—space helps them crisp.
Try using freshly grated Parmesan for the best crust.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on oil/cheese amounts.

title: Spinach & Artichoke Stuffed Mushrooms
description: Bite-sized mushrooms stuffed with creamy spinach-artichoke filling.
ingredients: 1/2 cup chopped spinach (fresh or thawed frozen, squeezed dry)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Remove stems from mushrooms and place caps on a baking sheet.
Mix cream cheese, spinach, artichokes, mozzarella, Parmesan, garlic, salt, and pepper.
Spoon filling into mushroom caps.
Bake 18–22 minutes until mushrooms are tender and tops are lightly golden.
notes: If using frozen spinach, squeeze out as much water as possible.
Serve immediately for the best texture.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on cheese amounts.

title: Honey Glazed Carrots
description: Tender carrots tossed in buttery honey glaze—simple and crowd-friendly.
ingredients: Optional: pinch of cinnamon or fresh thyme
instructions: Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add carrots and cook 6–8 minutes until just tender. Drain.
Return carrots to the pot. Add butter and honey and stir until glossy.
Season with salt and add cinnamon or thyme if using.
Serve warm.
notes: For deeper flavor, roast carrots at 425°F for 20–25 minutes, then toss with honey and butter.
Add a squeeze of orange juice for a citrusy version.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on honey/butter used.

title: Southern-Style Baked Mac & Cheese
description: Creamy baked mac with a golden top—pure comfort food.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Cook macaroni 1 minute less than package directions. Drain.
Whisk milk, eggs, melted butter, salt, pepper, paprika, and mustard powder (optional).
In the baking dish, combine macaroni with cheeses, reserving a handful for the top.
Pour milk mixture over noodles, stir, and top with reserved cheese.
Bake 35–40 minutes until set and golden.
notes: Let rest 10 minutes before slicing for cleaner servings.
Mix in cooked bacon or jalapeños for a tailgate twist.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on cheese type and serving size.

title: Garlic Knots with Marinara Dip
description: Soft, buttery garlic knots—perfect with warm marinara for dipping.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (205°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment.
Divide dough into 10–12 pieces. Roll each into a rope and tie into a knot.
Bake 12–15 minutes until lightly golden.
Mix melted butter, garlic, parsley, salt, and Parmesan (optional). Brush over warm knots.
Serve with marinara.
notes: For extra browning, brush knots lightly with olive oil before baking.
These reheat well in the oven at 350°F for 5–7 minutes.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on dough brand and butter used.

title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Soft centers, crisp edges, and plenty of chocolate chips.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Line baking sheets with parchment.
Whisk flour, baking soda, and salt.
Cream butter and sugars until fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla.
Mix in dry ingredients until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips.
Scoop onto baking sheets and bake 10–12 minutes until edges are set.
Cool 5 minutes on the pan, then transfer to a rack.
notes: Chill dough 30 minutes for thicker cookies.
Swap half the chocolate chips for chopped dark chocolate for a richer bite.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on cookie size.

title: No-Bake Peanut Butter Bars
description: Rich peanut butter bars with a smooth chocolate topping—no oven needed.
ingredients: 1 tbsp coconut oil (optional, helps chocolate spread)
instructions: Line an 8x8-inch pan with parchment.
Mix peanut butter and melted butter. Stir in powdered sugar and graham cracker crumbs until thick.
Press mixture firmly into the pan.
Melt chocolate chips (and coconut oil if using) until smooth, then spread over the top.
Chill 1–2 hours until set, then slice.
notes: Use crunchy peanut butter for extra texture.
Store in the fridge for cleaner slices.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on bar size.

title: Apple Crisp with Oat Topping
description: Warm cinnamon apples under a buttery oat crumble—best with ice cream.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Toss apples with lemon juice, granulated sugar, cinnamon, and 2 tbsp flour. Spread in a baking dish.
Mix oats, brown sugar, 1/2 cup flour, and salt. Cut in butter until crumbly.
Sprinkle topping over apples.
Bake 35–45 minutes until bubbly and golden.
notes: Use a mix of sweet and tart apples for better flavor.
Let cool 10 minutes before serving so it thickens slightly.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on serving size.

title: Brownie Sundae Cups
description: Individual brownie cups filled with ice cream and toppings—party-perfect.
ingredients: 1 box brownie mix (or your favorite homemade brownie batter)
Ingredients required by the brownie mix (typically eggs, oil, water)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a muffin tin well.
Prepare brownie batter according to package directions.
Fill each muffin cup about 2/3 full and bake 18–22 minutes until set.
Cool 10 minutes, then gently press the center of each brownie down with a spoon to form a cup. Cool completely.
Fill with ice cream and top with chocolate sauce and optional toppings.
notes: Freeze the brownie cups before filling for extra clean assembly.
If brownies stick, run a thin knife around edges before removing.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and varies with ice cream and toppings.

title: Lemon Loaf Cake
description: Bright, moist lemon loaf finished with a sweet-tangy glaze.
ingredients: Glaze: 1 cup powdered sugar + 2–3 tbsp lemon juice
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and line a loaf pan with parchment.
Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk sugar, eggs, melted butter, milk, lemon zest, lemon juice, and vanilla.
Stir dry ingredients into wet until just combined.
Bake 50–60 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes, then remove from pan.
Whisk glaze ingredients and drizzle over cooled loaf.
notes: Don’t overmix—stir until just combined to keep the loaf tender.
Add poppy seeds for a lemon-poppy twist.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on glaze amount.

title: Weeknight Chicken Tacos
description: Fast, flavorful chicken tacos with endless topping options.
ingredients: 1 1/2 lbs boneless chicken breasts or thighs, sliced
Toppings: shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, cheese, salsa, sour cream, lime wedges
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Add chicken and cook 6–8 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Sprinkle in taco seasoning and water. Stir and simmer 2–3 minutes until saucy and chicken is cooked through.
Warm tortillas and assemble tacos with toppings.
notes: Add sliced onions and peppers to the skillet for extra veggies.
Swap chicken for shrimp—cook shrimp 2 minutes per side.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and varies with tortillas and toppings.

title: Breakfast-for-Dinner Hash
description: Crispy potatoes, sausage, peppers, and eggs—breakfast vibes, dinner timing.
ingredients: Optional: hot sauce, shredded cheese, green onions
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes, salt, pepper, and paprika.
Cook potatoes 12–15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until crispy and tender.
Add sausage, breaking it up, and cook 5–6 minutes until browned.
Stir in bell pepper and onion and cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Make 4 small wells and crack in eggs. Cover and cook 4–6 minutes until eggs are set to your liking.
Top with optional toppings and serve.
notes: Parboil potatoes for 5 minutes first if you want extra-fast crisping.
Use turkey sausage for a lighter option.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and varies with sausage and toppings.

title: Air Fryer Chicken Tenders
description: Crispy, juicy tenders without deep frying—kid-approved and quick.
instructions: Preheat air fryer to 400°F (205°C).
Season chicken with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
Dip chicken in beaten eggs, then coat with panko (mix in Parmesan if using).
Spray basket with cooking spray and place tenders in a single layer. Spray tops lightly.
Air fry 10–12 minutes, flipping halfway, until golden and cooked through (165°F).
Serve with your favorite dipping sauce.
notes: Cook in batches—overcrowding prevents crisping.
Swap panko for crushed cornflakes for extra crunch.
nutrition: Nutrition is estimated and depends on breading thickness and dips.
